original_title: Digital transactions via LankaPay outpace GDP of Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: Contrary to the popular belief that the country is way behind in its digital transformation, Sri Lanka’s economic heartbeat now pulses digitally with LankaPay as its lifeblood. Transcending its original role as a mere payment system, LankaPay has emerged as the country’s digital backbone, laying the foundation for rapid economic growth.

In 2023, LankaPay’s digital transactions exceeded the nation’s GDP, emphasizing the transformative impact of digital payments on the economy. Nearly half of Sri Lanka’s economic output was transacted via real-time payment transactions through LankaPay’s interbank fund transfers. By operating 24X7X365 and prioritizing security, speed and accessibility, LankaPay empowers both businesses and individuals: businesses benefit from efficiency, faster operations and market reach, while individuals gain quicker access to funds stimulating economic activity nationwide.
This achievement demonstrates the profound effect of digital financial transactions on Sri Lanka’s economy, with LankaPay driving this pivotal shift.

By routing most domestic financial transactions through its local network, LankaPay reduces the dependence on international networks, keeping financial flows within Sri Lanka and saving billions in fees and commissions that would otherwise go overseas.

LankaPay also facilitates significant savings as the economy shifts away from cash, reducing the costs associated with printing, issuing, distributing, transporting and providing security to currency – an estimated expense of 1.5% of GDP to the economy. The cost of cash rivals the 2% of GDP spent on entire education sector in Sri Lanka digital transactionscould save the country billions of rupees that could be repurposed to provide social benefits. Through digital payment options such as CEFTS, JustPay, LankaQR and SLIPS, LankaPay enables millions of cashless transactions at a value of more than 100 billion rupees each day, easing the financial strain of a cash-based economy.

LankaPay’s mission has always been rooted in financial inclusivity, ensuring that citizens, regardless of location, can access secure and efficient financial services. Sri Lanka Interbank Payment System (SLIPS), one of the pioneering services launched by LankaPay, enables same-day electronic fund transfers across the country. SLIPS now facilitates nearly 70% of all salary payments in the country, contributing to nationwide economic stability by ensuring timely fund access for millions of employees.
